I really like @aclementsÂ´s idea. I am doing a libray that interprets the JSON protocol[1] from the gpsd daemon, and gpsd will truncate[2] all JSON responses after the 1536th character (byte?), so i need to create a streaming JSON reader that fill in the closing } and ] in the correct sequence. An extended JSON decoder would be very useful.

[1]: gpsd JSON core protocol:
http://manpages.ubuntu.com/manpages/trusty/man5/gpsd_json.5.html

[2] is from [1]:

    The length limit for responses and reports is 1536 characters, 
    including trailing newline; longer responses will be truncated, 
    so client code must be prepared for the possibility of invalid 
    JSON fragments.
